newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit stays in range ahead of weekend.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit stays in range ahead of weekend.

text.p: The ringgit was rangebound in European trading due to a general lack of interest in regional currencies, dealers said on Friday.
"Everybody is scaling their operations before the year-end. Moreover, there is the month-end factor," said a dealer with a foreign bank in Kuala Lumpur.
Dealers said there was mild dollar buying interest, but the ringgit had delinked from the strong movements of major currencies.
"But, dollar/ringgit lacks any momentum of its own," said a dealer with a Malaysian bank.
"There is no news, no fresh leads and there is no commercial buying either. Moreover, it is the month-end as well as the weekend," said a dealer with another Malaysian bank.
"It will stay in the 2.52/35 range in the near-term," another dealer said.
But, some dealers said rising domestic interest rates and a generally bullish stock market may attract some foreign funds to the country next week.
At 1130 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.5254/61 a dollar against 2.5275/85 at close in Kuala Lumpur on Thursday.
